data.title: Emmanuelle Chriqui's Dating and Relationship History
data.meta_description: Who is Emmanuelle Chriqui dating? Many famous men have dated Entourage star Emmanuelle Chriqui, and this list will give you more details about these lucky ...
data.text:
Emmanuelle Chriqui and Adrian Bellani shared a passionate romance that began in September 2013, after meeting at an industry event. The couple was frequently spotted enjoying each other's company at various Hollywood hotspots, stirring gossip about their burgeoning relationship. However, despite their best efforts to keep their personal lives private, the two remained a fixture in the gossip columns for the duration of their relationship, which lasted approximately two years. Ultimately, the couple amicably parted ways in 2015, leaving fans to speculate about the cause of their split.

Adrian Bellani, born as Salvador Zerboni, first gained recognition as a soap opera actor on the daytime series Passions when he played the role of Miguel Lopez-Fitzgerald. Stepping away from the world of soap operas, he later landed roles in television shows such as CSI: Miami and Rizzoli & Isles. Aside from his acting career, Bellani is also known for his philanthropic work and involvement with charitable organizations, further solidifying his status within the Hollywood community. Before dating Chriqui, Bellani was linked to several high-profile actresses, including Roselyn Sanchez.

Prior to her relationship with Adrian Bellani, Emmanuelle Chriqui was romantically linked to Clifton Collins, Jr. Diving headfirst into their relationship, Chriqui and Collins made numerous public appearances together, garnering significant media attention. However, after a year of dating in the limelight, the couple decided to call it quits in 2007, yet their admiration and respect for one another remained intact.

Best known for his diverse range of roles in films such as Capote, Traffic, and Star Trek, Clifton Collins, Jr. has made a name for himself as a talented and versatile actor. Though primarily known for his work in dramatic films, Collins has also dabbled in comedy, starring in projects such as Extract and The Boondock Saints II: All Saints Day. Beyond his acting career, the talented actor is a respected figure in the entertainment industry for his charity work and commitment to giving back. Collins has previously been linked to other high-profile actresses, including Jennifer Garner.

Emmanuelle Chriqui and Jeremy Sisto first met on the set of their joint project Wrong Turn in 2003, where they were cast as love interests. The chemistry between the two was undeniable, leading them to embark on a brief real-life romance. Despite their strong connection on-screen and off, the couple only dated for a few months before deciding to amicably end their relationship. They remained on good terms with one another, often praising each other's work in interviews.

Gaining notoriety as an actor in both film and television, Jeremy Sisto is best known for his roles in Clueless, Six Feet Under, and Law & Order. His versatile acting abilities have allowed him to effortlessly shift between genres, showcasing his talent in dramatic, comedic, and even thriller productions. Beyond his film and television appearances, Sisto has also found success as a stage actor, receiving critical acclaim for his performances in various theater productions. Previously, Sisto was involved in high-profile relationships with actresses Marisa Ryan and Addison Timlin.

In 2005, Emmanuelle Chriqui and JC Chasez briefly crossed paths and shared a romantic fling. The two first met through mutual friends in the entertainment industry, immediately hitting it off, and engaging in a short-lived romance that lasted just a few months. During their time together, photographs of the couple attending events and enjoying casual outings fueled gossip about their burgeoning relationship. Sadly, their whirlwind romance ultimately fizzled out, leaving both stars to focus on their thriving careers.

Achieving worldwide fame as a member of the iconic boy band *NSYNC, JC Chasez has enjoyed a successful career in music, both as a performer and songwriter. Following his success with *NSYNC, Chasez branched out into a solo career, releasing the album Schizophrenic which showcased his powerful vocals and songwriting ability. In addition to music, he has ventured into the world of acting, making appearances in television shows such as Ghost Whisperer and Glee. As a high-profile entertainer, Chasez has been linked to several famous women over the years, including Tara Reid and Bobbie Thomas.
